Reviews.Title: “This is a prison! Don't go!”
Reviews.Author: anonymous1987Zurich
Reviews.Content: At first, we thought the place was relatively nice. The room was small but cozy. However, when we talked to the reception lady, it turned out that this place has a 1 am curfew. This was not advertised anywhere, so we were a bit disappointed. They also said that the front door is closed after 1 am but we can still get out and be back after 7 am. We came back from the bar at 12:55 am and wanted to bring inside some local friends but we were confronted by extremely abnoxious staff and realized that we also cannot bring guests. There was a fake customer who was spying on other guests and reporting to the management. There were also cameras monitoring the activities of guests. I was able to escape at 1:10 am but my friends were unfortunately trapped inside because the "bald guy" (the fake customer) closed another glass door between the first and the second floor, and no one was able to leave the hotel (although we should have been able to leave). We believe that this is a serious violation of safety protocol in the province of Venice and of human rights (constituting false inprisonment which is restraint of a person in a bounded area without justification or consent. False imprisonment is a common-law felony and a tort and I assure you that this post is completely serious.) If you believe in human rights and you would like to enjoy your stay in Venice after 1 am with no prison guards, do not book a room in this hostel. Best Regards, a customer

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: KellyMath22
Reviews.Content: We didn't have high expectations coming into this place but it was just right. Te rooms were very similar to dorm rooms. We had two twin sized beds and our own bathroom so that was perfect. There was air condition so that was great for the hot weather while we were there. The only issue was that if too many people had their air conditioners on it would blow the fuse or something and then the air conditioning (and the wi-fi!) would be off for ten minutes or so but it always came back on quickly. The location was right near the train station which was nice since I couldn't imagine dragging suitcases any farther. What was also great was that getting around venice is hard - maps are useless. But since we were close to the train station there were always signs directing us there so we had no trouble getting back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but they have no heating system!”
Reviews.Author: Mariliava
Reviews.Content: It is very easy to reach the hotel, very near the train station S. Lucia. If you are on a budget it is ok. Though be sure to ask for a room with a decent heating!! I went there on winter and we couldn't heat the room. There was only an air conditioner that reached 25oC. This is not heating system!!! We were very cold taking shower and when sleeping. so if you are staying here, ask for a room with heating (if they have one). Be prepared to climb stairs with suitcases... no elevators. There are several types of rooms in this hotels, so be sure of what you are booking. You can walk to San Marco square, 20-30 min walking.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Place to put your head.”
Reviews.Author: LaVieEnCharmCity
Reviews.Content: Nothing special, just a cheap room to spend a few hours each night. Good location near the train station (suitcases on the streets of Venice are not fun!). Clean, new towels each day. Stayed with my brother in a 2-twin-bed private room. The bathroom was private - we had a key to it - but we had to leave the bedroom to enter it. They wanted us to turn in our room key every time we left, but we did not heed their request (security concerns) and there were no problems. Free Wifi in the lobby and outdoor cafe area. Generally I would say it is not worth the money, but everything in Venice is expensive and it's worth it to be on the island rather than going in and out every day.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: amy379
Reviews.Content: awesome location just minutes down from the main station and the water taxis. the rooms were small but all u need! close to loads of shops and little cafes. no lift but the stairs are really not bad at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location.”
Reviews.Author: JuanKong
Reviews.Content: Went for our honeymoon. Hotel is located above a clothing store on the plaza. It was quite odd checking in as reception is located Hotel San Geremia (hotel next door). Hotel complex and room has access card in which room are extremely secure, whilst we stayed there we felt very secure. Room was quite small but Venice is quite old so I assume most rooms would be. Great value for what we paid for double bed with bathroom. Bed was one of the hardest beds I've ever slept on equivalent to foam on concrete floor. Free wifi was very good. Very quiet at nights. Location is great and safe, pretty much away from most tourist attractions. 3 minute walk to train station and 30 minute walk to St Mark's Square. The plaza the hotel is on can be annoying as African immigrants setup their fake handbags there and hassle anyone that walk past and also people trying to get you to do surveys. There's a supermarket about a 5 minute walk away and a very expensive laundry mat as well. Restaurants are abundant in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: RalphMedders
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in a triple room with an en-suite bathroom. The room overlooked the campo, which was very nice. The only problem with this was that one morning we were woken by a union rally, but I imagine this isn't a common occurance! The room and bathroom was clean and thanks to air conditioning, very cool and comfortable. The bathroom was very small, but the shower was pretty good and not overly cramped. Given what we paid for the rooms, we were very impressed. Would recommend this to any students looking to explore Venice on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, a slow receptionist and nice location”
Reviews.Author: S_Chandrasekhar
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a day here and it took us quite a while to get ourselves checked in. The receptionist was exceedingly slow making us wait for beyond 10 minutes.However, that was the only bad part.The rooms are compact and 'extremely' neat.In fact they could easily be a star hotel.Its just a stone's throw away from the station.Checkout is at 10am, while checkin is at 2pm.Its a fair distance away from St. Marks' square which is where most tourists head, but the Vaporetto is right next to the station.Considering how expensive most places in Venice to stay are, this place turned out to be great value for money

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location”
Reviews.Author: pamusement
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical booking here, given how far it looks from sites of interest on the map. But in reality, this place is beautifully situated mere steps from the train station, in front of which is a vaporetto stop (the Venetian equivalent of a bus stop). The vaporetto to Piazza San Marco is under 15 minutes. Close by are more shops and restaurants and gelaterias than anyone could want. We were able to walk to areas of interest like the Jewish Ghetto, Ca d'Oro, and Rialto. As for service, our room was always clean and the staff was helpful enough. I was rather impressed when, upon my arrival in a tired sweat, the owner himself dashed out and returned with a lemon popsicle for me. That gesture told me a lot. Oh, and they let my friend store her bicycle in their storage room. Make no mistake: these are simple, unpretentious accommodations. This place is perfect for no frills travelers. I would put it somewhere between a good old fashioned youth hostel and a low end B&B, though some of the rooms are multiple bed occupancy, like a hostel. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TouringEverywhere
Reviews.Content: We only paid 70 euro a night for this hotel and were more than happy. It is within 5 minutes from the train station and is surrounded by cafes, restaurants and opportunities to buy souvenirs. Its about a 30min walk to the very popular San Marco, but it is so crowded there i was happy we were staying away from it. The area felt safe and the lady in reception couldnt have been more helpful. Hotel had free wifi and it worked perfectly. Only bad thing was no elevator, and we stayed on the 4th floor. 79 stairs with suitcases wasnt that much fun, but this is really my only complaint. We booked a double room, it was small, but we used it to sleep not to hang out. The air conditioning was also fantastic. I would recommend this hotel and we would stay again if ever in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: mouni99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the train station, which is very convenient. There are many shops and restaurants around the hotel, therefore, even the hotel does not offer breakfast, we had no trouble finding a breakfast place. The room was big (we have a five people room). The room was clean, so does the bothroom. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Surrounding environment was pleasant. The only trouble we had was the internet. They gave us login information for each one of us (each device); however, only one device could get on internet. The internet connection wasn't strong either. We asked the staff, and they told us everything was fine at their end, so we thought it was the location of our room. The other downside of the hotel was it doesn't have an elevator. If you got a room on the fourth floor or above? Good luck! Other than that, we liked the place.

Reviews.Title: “There are so many wrong things about this hostel”
Reviews.Author: Nat_a1985
Reviews.Content: I chose this hostel because it is within a walking distance from the train station, cheap and because it's not in the mainland. That all the good things I have to say about this hostel. I went there and found out it was undergoing renovations so I spent a lot of time looking for its sister hostel which was across the street (they didn't put much effort on the signs) WIFI could only be used in a room they used to store suitcases and where there happened to be other two computers. Oh, that was the only common room. They gave me 30 mins of free WIFI per day. If you check out but you don't take your suitcases with you, they'll look after them for free (in that room where everybody has access to it) Rooms were big but not big enough for the five people who were in it. Bathroom was small and OLD. It happened to have a curtain shower that would take up the whole bathroom so I showered over the toilet. It was impossible for other guests to use it afterwards because there was an inch of water that would stick around! Last but not least, My room was on the second floor and there's no elevator. Plus, the staircase is very narrow so it was really hard for me to get my staff up there.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean in great location”
Reviews.Author: Feyana
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very small but really clean with good A/C. We actually got our own bathroom despite that we booked a shared one. Really close to the train. Despite being far from the sites it is close to transport so its not a big deal. Street its on has everything you need: restaurants, souvenier stands, shops, grocery store (if your budgeting like us), post office, etc. Did have wi/fi but it was not a great connection.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good option for staying in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: fourty12
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Italy and Venice was our first stop. We didn't have anything booked ahead of time but made a reservation for 1 night at the Alloggi Gerotto Calderan (operated by Hotel San Geremia) while in Amsterdam airport en route to Venice. Receptionist was super nice and helpful... Emailed me perfect travel directions singe we were arriving late. The room was basic, sort of hostel like, which was fine with us. It was private, quiet and clean. As far as rooms in Venice goes, I don't think they get much better unless you are prepared to spend big money. Free WiFi with some tables out front where we could use laptop/iPhone while basking in the sun and drink cappuccino/wine/beer. The service & location was so good that we immediately booked 2 more nights. We met some fellow travelers who were in the actual hostel, paying the same as us but having to share a room with 2 other people. For the same price, we had a small private room, double bed, private bathroom. 1 a.m. curfew could be a bit of an issue if you intend on staying out all night. We found it no problem as we couldn't wait to get some sleep before waking up for the next cappuccino! They are in an awesome neighborhood (Cannaregio), very close to the train and bus station which is priceless because watching people lug suitcases on/off boats, over bridges, up stairs, etc looked pretty frustrating. I'd highly recommend Alloggi Gerotto Calderan/Hotel San Geremia for a budget trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean. Great price for Venice.”
Reviews.Author: JSGJJR
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double w/ our own bathroom. It was nicer than I expected for the low price. The Calderan is in a rather busy area, which can be both good and bad, depending on your preference. The hotel is close to the train/bus station and it was nice to not have to take other transportation to get to it. It was easy to find (unlike other places we stayed in Venice). The 1 a.m. curfew was a bit of a pain -- one night we were out having a good time and had to cut it short. Otherwise we were very pleased with the room and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but clean room, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: punkatilla
Reviews.Content: Venice is much bigger and more crowded than I'd realised, so was really glad for this location only 5 minutes from the train station. I really liked the Cannaregio neighborhood as well - lots of nice bars and restaurants within a 15 minute walk away. The hotel looks a bit sketchy from the outside and the foyer/stairwell is quite worn, but our room was very clean and quaint. The room and its bathroom were really tiny, but a comfy bed and perfect if you just need a place to crash. We requested a view of the square which was a treat as well. I didn't find it too noisy as some other reviewers mentioned - once the windows were closed you couldn't hear a thing. We paid about 260 euros in total for 3 nights (double, no breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: EBernasC
Reviews.Content: We were lucky and got a room in te hotel and not the pension, the room was clean and comfortable and the view to the church across the piazza was great. No breakfast though. Best of all the location, you can walk from the train station in no more than five minutes.

Reviews.Title: “We were woken up twice by noisy staff”
Reviews.Author: jpltCapeTown
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location â€“ close to the train station, which is important in Venice since you pretty much have to drag your suitcase to where you are going. The building and room are very old, even crusty. The guy who greeted us was friendly, but his English wasnâ€™t great. At 1h30 in the morning (curfew is at 1), we were woken up by a tremendous noise, which was this guy throwing garbage into black bags right outside our room (i.e. the guy who signed us in, and he was doing this inside the hotel). Then, at 6h30 in the morning, the same guy threw bedding against the wall of our room, again waking us up.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the train station and a lot of shops”
Reviews.Author: Choco_robba
Reviews.Content: After getting off the bus, it was very easy to find this hotel. It's really two hotels with two different names but one reception. We stayed in the building where reception was. We had a nice view of San Geremia. Walkable distance to the main waterbus stop. We stayed for 2 nights. There is no elevator in our building. Luckily we lived on the 2nd floor, but there were quite a bit of steps. Our room was made and we received fresh towels on the second day of our stay. The water pressure for the shower was a bit weak and I had to wait a few minutes for the water to warm up each time I took a shower. There is a hairdryer in the room. There's a tv in the room but it was left unplugged in our room. The area is pretty noisy at night and there are church bells that ring in the morning 7am but this happens in each city anyways, so it's really unavoidable. Wi-fi here is not free. You have to pay 1 Euro for every 15 minutes or there is a public computer that is 1 Euro for every 15 minutes and there's a countdown. My only problem was, my friend and I had bought 15 min each for wifi, and we couldn't get it to work. We found out wifi works best near the luggage storage. So, another person who worked at the hotel was checking on that, and I gave up and bought 1 Euro for the public computer. The reception person at first misunderstood what I wanted. He told me I could not change the wifi receipt for the computer, and I explained how I wanted to use the computer. So he took the receipt with the login name and password for wifi and threw it away and gave me a new access for the computer. At that moment, another worker was fixing up something and suddenly wifi had worked on my friend's iphone. So we think that originally wifi wasn't on. It was an honest mistake, and I don't think the receptionist was trying to take 1 euro from me but it was just an annoying episode.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: laurawh77
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. From the get go they were incredibly nice and wonderful customer service. When I booked my hotel I requested a room with a view (as recommended by another traveler) and when we got there they had that request on file and there it was- a gorgeous view of the amazing Campo Geremia. Check it wasn't until 2pm and we they did not have a locked room for our luggage which made me slightly uneasy but we left our bag at the back where they told us to leave them and they were fine. Our room had a cute and but slightly dated design but the gorgeous coloured hallways made the rooms and the hotel feel lovingly tended. The view is great and not very loud. AMAZING LOCATION. yes it's not in the heart of the city but this area is a great unknown gem. great restaurants, seconds away from a vaporette that will take you right down to the center of the city. best prices in tourist gift in this area too! Hot water was great in the shower and the staff although their english was not always the best were really nice and fun to be around.

Reviews.Title: “Be adaptable, the rooms are clean, but you may be in another building.”
Reviews.Author: FamilyOnVacationABC
Reviews.Content: Bad news: we were tired already, and our room was another 200+ meters further. Good news: 3 doors away was one of the best bakery/deli/cornerstore/confection shops in Venice. More good news, the location was closer to St. Marks (by foot). Best news: we discovered how to work the a/c. You'll want to be in this building if you do not want a curfew (1am, I believe). Do all the rooms have a/c? I don't know. I recommend you specify that you want it when you book. Venice was hot in early June, I can't imagine what it would be like in the heat of summer. As always, for the budget traveller the rooms are often noisy. Ours was right over the main pedestrian path which stays busy throughout the night. Figure out the a/c and shut the windows and shutters. Tip: their main reception closes at 8pm and their evening reception is up a flight of stairs (and then back down, and then another 200+ meters if your room is in the building ours was in). In addition there was some confusion about where exactly our room was which almost necessitated another trip up and down the stairs. Try to check in before 8pm.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean hotel close to bus & train station....”
Reviews.Author: OceanMyst
Reviews.Content: The Alloggi Gerotto Calderan is located in a convenient location within 10 minutes walk from both the bus and train station. Our room was overlooking Campo San Geremia Square. It was quite loud because of this and the church bells ring quite often. The walls of the room are paper thin so you may need earplugs if you are a light sleeper. We had a double room, which was comfortable and cleaned daily. Our bathroom was just down the hall and we were the only ones with the key to open it. I must say the cleaning staff were very very loud in the mornings talking to each from one room to the next. Overall we had a pleasant stay, it's a good option if you are on a budget and just want somewhere to lay your head at night. If you do stay here and want a cheap but yummy lunch or breakfast, I would recommend the"Brek Restaurant" on Lista Di Spagna just minutes away from the Hotel. They have great paninis and yummy snacks. They have no cover or service charge.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place in a tough town to get decent!”
Reviews.Author: mingo77212
Reviews.Content: We stayed at their sister building right next to it even though we had booked a room at Allogi, I think it was called San Geremia (?), owned by the same people apparently. Anyhow, the room was very small but clean, and we had a private bathroom which was cool to have after many days of sharing. It's a 5 minute walk to the train which is convenient but also about a 30-40 minute walk to San Marco. There is a vaporetto stop nearby. My main misgiving about it is that our room faced the square and the church bells get LOUD in the early morning. Yes, I guess that's part of the charm of Europe and what have you...but your butt is gonna be up at the crack of dawn. Also a bit annoying is the 1am curfew, however...it does keep partying teens/college students from staying here (it happened to us in Florence!).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Cheap, on a Busy, Noisy Square in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BloodRedBird
Reviews.Content: Having seen some photos of the location of Aloggi Gerotto Calderan, and reading that it was on a lovely square, we requested a room on the square itself, which also had a small balcony (not big enough to stand on though). This was a mistake. The square is one of the busiest in Venice and when we arrived at 10pm there were buskers, stalls, guys throwing those whizzy kids toys up in the air, restaurants with seating outside and a bar underneath our room. If you don't mind noise, this won't be a problem for you (and nor will the chuch bell constantly ringing) but we barely got any sleep and the next morning asked to be moved to an internal room. The staff were quite surprised, because the rooms on the square are bigger and more sought after, but we preferred a smaller room and some sleep. Which was just as well because the room really was miniscule! My partner and I couldn't walk past each other at the end of the bed! The bathroom was much better than the ones outside the rooms though (which are so small you almost have to dry yourself standing in the toilet) and the room was actually really cosy, clean and quiet. The staff were really lovely about moving us too and let us look at the new room before we took it. The fact that the hotel is 10 minutes walk from the train station is good. The fact that it is on one of the main routes through Venice is bad, because there is a constant stream of people passing through. We'd been to Venice before, and value the tiny streets and peace and mystery of the place, so this didn't really suit us, but wouldn't be a problem (in fact, is probably a bonus) for most people. Overall a good, cheap, clean stay in a very expensive city, but I reccomend an internal room (all of which have windows, ours looked over lovely slate rooftops) to get some rest after a long day roaming the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: BCTravelBug404
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a six bed dorm. The location is very good, a five minute walk from the train station and bus stop and minutes to the Grand Canal. There are also a lot of shops around. Everything in Venice is so easy to get to. The neighbourhood is safe. The room was clean and safe. The only things I would mention is that the shared bathroom in the six bed dorm had no lock in it. Which is a problem if no one knows you are in there! Also, there was only one key for the dorm, so whoever was last to leave the room would drop off the key and the first one back would pick it up. Other than that. Great location and great value for Venice. A tip for Venice, get the 3 day vaporetto pass, saves having to stand in the line ups, easy way to get back to your hotel when your feet are aching, and it's nice to just cruise all the routes and check out the neighbouring islands.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DSJkjm
Reviews.Content: A perfect location whether you arrive by train or by ferry and disembark at Guglie. I had a single room with its own bathroom, it was perfect. Small in size, but excellent for what I wanted and certainly value for money. The staff were always friendly and helpful. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “All in all, a lovely hotel in a beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: johnny_number9
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is pretty ideal. If you're travelling to Venice you should definitely consider getting a hotel on the islands rather than the mainland, and you could do much worse than this one. It is set in a lovely square, and there are lots of fairly reasonable (by Venetian standards at least) restaurants and shops in the immediate vicinity. It's also really near bus, train and vaporetto stops, so you can easily access all the major sights of Venice. Although it is based quite a substantial distance from St Mark's on foot (about 40 mins at a slow pace provided you don't get lost), Venice itself is so beautiful that you probably won't even notice how long you've been walking. The rooms are small but adequate and the friendly staff keep them pristine.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: legallyblonde63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 2 nights and I must say I was pretty impressed with what we got for the price! For 80 euro we got a decent size room with 2 big windows overlooking the square, we not only had our own private bathroom in our room, but we had 3 beds! (2 twins and 1 double) The shower was good, very clean and the water pressure was good. The bed was pretty comfortable, nothing to complain about. And the best part is, it's so close to the train station! It was the perfect place for our budget vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, good location, but some annoyances”
Reviews.Author: TUKO666
Reviews.Content: We knew beforehand that finding a reasonably priced, good and well located room in Venice would be difficult, so we left Venice for the end of our trip and looked for a place only for 1 night. To start, this is not a hotel but more of a pension. Well located less than 10 minute walk from the train station. We stayed in a double room with its own private bathroom and air conditioning (very important for this time of the year). Overall the room was small but clean (the smell of bleach from the bathroom almost knocked us out when we arrived!). First annoyance was the check-in time, which was about 2-3pm (!!). Same thing with the check out time at about 10am. You will notice they are kicking you out because the air conditioning doesn't work anymore past some time in the morning. Because of these weird check-in/out times we had to leave our luggage in a corridor piled up with many other bags from other guests. We though this was very unsafe as anyone could easily take something without the person at the reception even noticing about it. Second annoyance: you can only pay in cash. No option of breakfast, and the doors are locked at 1am, with the ridiculous excuse of "there's no much to do in Venice after 1am....". Overall, is a nightmare to find a decent accommodation in Venice and this place is a decent option unless you want to spend 200 euro a night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne001
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hostel. It was conveniently located near the major train station, however, if you would like to stay close to San Marco Square, this is not for you. Having said this, the walk through the backstreets of Venice everyday was one of the highlights of this trip! We enjoyed our stay in this accommodation as it was clean, very comfortable and great value for money. The room was basic but we did not want anything apart from a clean, comfortable bed and a clean bathroom and that is what we got. There was also a computer with internet connection which had to be shared but never proved a problem for us. Overall, we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly personnel”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Kan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Alloggi Gerotto Calderan for 4 nights in June 2009. The hotels is situated in a beautiful square and its location is really practical (close to Piazzale Roma, train station, many sites). The rooms are tiny but very clean. The personell however is terrible...first of all they have a policy of locking the door at 01.00 p.m. which means that if ou want to spend a night out in Venice...you either have to forget the thought or stay out until the morning that the door opens again...They do not mention that on the website, its only written in the confirmation e-mail you get after booking!!! But this didnt happen with us - it was not written on the e-mail either...The manager was very unpolite during the whole conversation and for the rest of our stay he kept behaving in the same manner... There are not many things to do in Venice at night but this silly policy can ruin a romantic night out. I only suggest this hotel to those that dont mind being restricted by that..

Reviews.Title: “very close to the train station, very clean”
Reviews.Author: asmOak
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for five nights in August. The airconditioning worked wonderfully and our room was a beautiful view of the San Geremia square and church. We had a bathroom outside of the room that was only for our use - and they price was great! Very clean as well, and so close to the train station and bus station. Only small downside is that Venice is large and it is at least 20-25 minute walk to get to the main sites. Overall, a wonderful hotel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “small but very clean and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: zoe_minmin
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, just a few steps from the station and Alghough the room is a little small, it is extremly clean and everything is like new. The people at front desk is very friendly and useful. I definitly will come back and recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Payed for a hotel, but it looked like more a hostel.”
Reviews.Author: MauPL
Reviews.Content: The hotel had many rules that made it look like we were staying in a hostel. The room was too small. the bathroom too. The walls are so thin they look like paper. The place is averege. Not too far, not to close.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Basic Necessities”
Reviews.Author: eadgawetrgeg
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a clean place to stay in Venice with no extras (no TV, no breakfast) and don't mind staying in a very small room then this place is for you. We had a double bed with a private bathroom located down the hall. The place was extremely clean and easy to get to from the bus (from the airport). There are places to eat everywhere in Venice so the lack of breakfast was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: Livvy01
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel due to its good reviews on trip advisor and wasn't dissapointed. The location is excellent, 10 mins walk from the train\bus station, especially if you are arriving in the evening. The room was very small but the bed was comfortable and the matching Provencal style furniture was a nice touch. The receptionists were very friendly and although there is no breakfast available there are three machines selling drinks, coffee and snacks you can buy from. Overall compared to the prices in other hotels this was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Best value and amenities in Venice”
Reviews.Author: batmanpastor
Reviews.Content: Venice is expensive, but this place is not. It is not but 5 minutes from the Venice railway station and located just off one of the main vaperetto/water taxi stops--very helpful to backpackers. In addition to a great location, the staff speak good English and the hotel is very clean. Yes, you do have to carry your luggage up the stairs to your rooms by yourself and there is no elevator--not a big deal this is the case with most places you stay in Italy. The hotel faces a public square where people congregate until 2:00 or so--but with the shutters and windows closed--no problem. Add ear plugs and you cannot hear anything-save the bell of the church across the street which rings the hour maybe from 7:00AM-9:00PM. Still, to me these only added some more romantic Venice atmosphere. We had a double room with a private bath for 90Euro a night. The rooms themselves are actually larger than most European rooms including a wardrobe a good shower. While I had friends that got many of these same ammenities for double the price per night--we were thoroughly happy with this hotel and recommend it to anyone looking for a private room for a good price in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved Venice and this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mousiev
Reviews.Content: This was a great find. The room was very clean and we had plenty of room. The bathroom was outside the room and was very clean. We were the only ones who had the key to the bathroom so that was nice. The location could not be better. We walked everywhere. It took about 20min or less to get to San Marco Sq. Also it was less than 5min to the train station which was very convient not to have to drag your luggage all around Vencie. The hotel staff were very helpful and pointed out the best route on the map for us. It was great! As Venice is a confusing maze. But it was a gorgeous city and the hotel was in a beautiful square with cafes and bars. There were lots of shops and gelaterias. I would recomend this place for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Goyo65
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just five minutes walk from the train station and is on a very nice square called Campo San Geremia. As there are no cars in Venice, having a hotel close to the train station is a good thing. Good value at â‚¬80/night. Booked directly with the hotel (http://www.casagerottocalderan.com), Room was small but adequate and very quite. Staff were very helpful and recommended good restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “a treat in the pricy city of venice”
Reviews.Author: potterh
Reviews.Content: My friend recommended this hotel to me and i checked Tripadvisor before booking. the hotel was very prompt with my inquiries through emails. we stayed there for 3 nights (102 euro/night) for a triple room with private bathroom. The hotel is a treat for 3 students on budget. The room was adequate but clean and spacious. A window with a view of the church and piazza. The A/C worked perfectly well which was super important as it was boiling hot in June when we stayed. No TV in the room so we felt a bit out of touch to the outside world for a few days. The location was excellent. A few minutes from the train station (turn left when you come out of the station and walk till you see a piazza. The hotel is on your left.) I am grateful that I didn't need the hassel of hauling my luggages across the bridge or finding a water taxi to take me to the hotel. The streets of Venice were extremely confusing and thank god i didn't have to look for my hotel in them. There's a laundry close by the hotel (9 euro for wash+dry). Would definately stay there again if I go to Venice.

HotelInfo.Name: Alloggi Gerotto Calderan
HotelInfo.Address: Campo San Geremia 283, 30121 Venice, Italy
